Creating Revision Labels

Like view labels, new revision labels can be created from the View menu. In fact, if you are creating a new revision label based on an existing revision label in another view, you must use the View menu for this purpose.

However, revision labels can also be created from the Folder menu, a component menu, or the context menu. For this method of creating a revision label, see Labeling Items.

To create a new revision label for selected items (from the View menu):

  1. Select a folder from the folder hierarchy.

  2. Click a component tab.

  3. Select one or more items from the upper pane

  4. On the View or context menu, click Labels.

  5. Click the Revision tab. The Labels dialog lists the existing labels in reverse chronological order, based on the time at which they were created.

  6. Click New to create a new label and add its name to the list box. The Revision Label dialog opens.

  7. Enter a name and description for the label in the appropriate text boxes. The maximum label name length is 64 characters and the description length is 254 characters.

  8. (Optional) To freeze this label, so that revisions attached to it cannot be changed, select the Frozen check box.

  9. Click OK to exit the dialog.
